intro: Carex lasiocarpa subsp. americana, commonly known as the American haircap moss, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. This species is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially shaded environments. The plant is often found in wetlands, along stream banks, and in other damp habitats.
